perturbation.original_text: Hearing Aids are amplification devices primarily designed to compensate for hearing loss, designed for listening only (through a microphone, telecoil, Direct Audio Input or other similar audio pathways and run on a low power hybrid circuit. Hearing Aids may include in-the- ear Hearing Aids (ITE), behind-the-ear Hearing Aids (BTE), or completely-in-the-canal Hearing Aids (CIC).
perturbation.changed_text: Hearing Aids are amplification devices primarily designed to compensate for hearing loss, designed for listening only (through a microphone, telecoil, Direct Audio Input or other similar audio pathways and run on a high power circuit. Hearing Aids may include in-the- ear Hearing Aids (ITE), behind-the-ear Hearing Aids (BTE), or completely-in-the-canal Hearing Aids (CIC).
perturbation.explanation: The modification of 'low power hybrid circuit' to 'high power circuit' in the definition of 'Hearing Aids' introduces an in-text contradiction. The original definition implies hearing aids are designed for low power consumption, suitable for continuous use. Changing 'low' to 'high' power directly contradicts this implicit characteristic, raising uncertainty about the hearing aids' design and usage, particularly in relation to battery life and safety. This is contradicting the definition of ALD in Section 2.1
perturbation.contradicted_text: Assisted Listening Device ("ALD") is a 1. One way communications device 2. Used for hearing protection or listening in challenging environments, and 3. Contains Ultra Low Power (ULP) DSP and or ULP Wireless technology

perturbation.original_text: For purposes of computing Royalty Payments, a sale shall occur when IntriCon receives payment from a customer for a Base Product Unit., or an Enhanced Product containing a Base Product; Services means technology transfer and other support provided to IntriCon by Dynamic Hearing;
perturbation.changed_text: For purposes of computing Royalty Payments, a sale shall occur when IntriCon ships a Base Product Unit, or an Enhanced Product containing a Base Product; Services means technology transfer and other support provided to IntriCon by Dynamic Hearing; unless IntriCon is not paid within 90 days of shipment.
perturbation.explanation: The modification shifts the definition of 'sale' for royalty calculation from 'receipt of payment' to 'shipment of product'. This contradicts with the payment clauses under Section 4.9 where a royalty payment is paid when IntriCon is paid, introducing ambiguity about when royalties are due, especially if IntriCon offers payment plans or experiences payment delays. Introducing contradictory terms on the time when royalty payments are applied.

perturbation.original_text: Confidential Information means information in relation to a party, including its business activities that in connection with this Agreement whether the information is in oral, visual or written form or is recorded or embodied in any other medium and includes all such information disclosed to, or accessed by, the other party before this Agreement commences;
perturbation.changed_text: Confidential Information means information in relation to a party, including its business activities that in connection with this Agreement whether the information is in oral, visual or written form or is recorded or embodied in any other medium and includes all such information disclosed to, or accessed by, the other party before the 1st day of January of 2009;
perturbation.explanation: By changing the end of the sentence to the '1st day of January of 2009' from 'Agreement commences', we are modifying what exactly is considered confidential information. This modification creates an ambiguity in what information is protected under the confidentiality clause. The original text protects all information exchanged before the agreement, while the modified text only protects information exchanged before January 1st, 2009. Since the agreement was effective October 1st, 2008. This would cause the rest of the agreement to contradict from clause 7.0. This change causes confusion regarding the scope of confidential information. A in-text contradiction is taking place here, since now some of the data exchanged between October 1st, 2008 and January 1st, 2009, would not be considered confidential due to the edited confidential information clause.
perturbation.contradicted_text: Each party must: (a) not disclose any Confidential Information to any person, except in confidence as permitted by this Agreement; (b) not use any Confidential Information except as reasonably necessary for the purpose of putting this Agreement into effect (Permitted Purpose); (c) restrict access to Confidential Information to those of its employees and officers for whom such access is not reasonably necessary for the Permitted Purpose; (d) ensure that its employees and officers comply with this Agreement; and (e) not reproduce or record, or permit or cause any reproduction or recording of, any Confidential Information except to the extent reasonably necessary for the Permitted Purpose.
